docs.text:
CNC Toolchain


I have been practicing a Scrivener 
MultiMarkdown
 workflow. One project is a CNC Toolchain Document (LaTex), covering a 
PCBModE
/Inkscape, 
FlatCAM
 and 
bCNC
 toolchain for my Cyclone PCB Factory CNC machine. Initially rather than Printed Circuit Boards I am seeking to make simple cutouts of objects in 3mm MDF or plywood. I have focused on two parts, a Huxley Extruder holder, and Y carriage frog. These are not complicated objects, but I hope they will serve to get some experience with the 
Cyclone
 machine geometry, particularly the z axis, plus milling bit selection and tool path feedrates. There has not been much time to 
make
.

I have just about kept up with Jeelabs, getting the 
JET/Hub
 up and running on an old Raspberry Pi B.


7 February 2016


MkDocs


Following the posts of jcw at 
Jeelabs
, I decided to implement a static website. From the many choices I liked the default theme of 
MkDocs
 best, after narrowing my choice based on Python and MarkDown. 


29 December 2015
docs.title: Home

docs.text:
I have been practicing a Scrivener  MultiMarkdown  workflow. One project is a CNC Toolchain Document (LaTex), covering a  PCBModE /Inkscape,  FlatCAM  and  bCNC  toolchain for my Cyclone PCB Factory CNC machine. Initially rather than Printed Circuit Boards I am seeking to make simple cutouts of objects in 3mm MDF or plywood. I have focused on two parts, a Huxley Extruder holder, and Y carriage frog. These are not complicated objects, but I hope they will serve to get some experience with the  Cyclone  machine geometry, particularly the z axis, plus milling bit selection and tool path feedrates. There has not been much time to  make . 
I have just about kept up with Jeelabs, getting the  JET/Hub  up and running on an old Raspberry Pi B.  7 February 2016
